intro: Cardamine unalaschcensis, commonly known as the Unalaschcens mountain buttercup, is a rare flowering plant native to the subarctic regions of North America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often yellow or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as alpine meadows and stream banks. It has delicate, trifoliate leaves with a hairy surface, and its flowers are usually solitary, with five sepals and numerous stamens. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
